this was my first venture into the world of Dell laptops , so I was not sure what to expect from this affordably priced offering .
First off , the specs are impressive for such a low - priced laptop .
a middle of the line nVidia graphics card is a steal of a deal at the current price Amazon is selling this laptop for .
Fear not though , I put this laptop on my trusty scale
the results came back as 4.2 lbs ( .4 lbs lighter than advertised ) .
you would like to do a lot of traveling with
you can afford paying almost three times as much , you might be better off looking at a Macbook
If you can not afford jumping up to the price of an Apple , this laptop will still be very convenient to tote around as it is very slim

sleek.

Setting up this laptop was extremely easy , as I was able to immediately connect it to my home WI - FI system .
I must admit it was a bit jolting ,
The next paragraph I am about to type is by far the most important

useful one to read , so if you are going to ready any paragraph , please read the one below.

This computer came with a trial - version of McAfee anti - virus software .
then you have to pay for it in order to keep getting virus definition updates .
Let me save you a lot of time
Microsoft has been providing free anti - virus software for Windows users for years via download .
The software is called Microsoft Security Essentials ,
is superior to all third party virus programs in the way
its free
it comes straight from Microsoft ,
an issue has come up
the issue involves their own software .
Companies like McAfee
Norton get their information from Microsoft , so there is always a lag .
prior , you would need to download Microsoft Security Essentials in order to get the anti - virus protection ,
with Windows 8 , it is already installed via a beefed up version of Windows Defender
includes Microsoft Security Essentials .
The trick is ,
this is important , you have to remove any third party anti - virus program before being able to turn on Windows Defender .
Microsoft had to do this in order to avoid getting sued by the big anti - virus companies ,
make no mistake about it , YOU DO NOT NEED TO PAY FOR ANTI - VIRUS PROTECTION EVER AGAIN .
turn on Windows Defender

Anti - virus rant over!

I have been using this laptop for the past several weeks
could not be happier with it .
The screen resolution is impressive ,
the built - in webcam works great for Skyping .
In the past I have been impressed with Dell for the workstations I have used at my company 's office ,
now I can appreciate them even more for creating a high quality affordable laptop .
awsome product .
i recommend

If you are looking at a T540p computer I recommend you run , do not walk towards another model of computer .
Having come from an excellent T520 laptop
While the laptop has good performance , the ergonomics on the laptop are terrible , as was Lenovo 's decision to change the AC power adapter plug design .
Too bad , while voltage
amperage remain identical to the previous generation of power adapters , they change the plug to a rectangular design ensuring new spares must be purchased.
likes to keep your fingers on the home keys
mouse buttons the new " ClickPad " touchpad on this device will drive you insane unless you disable the touchpad .
mouse buttons are integrated into one piece resulting in your mouse moving
you move your thumb over to left - click on the top - left corner of the touchpad .

Conversely , if you are a touchpad user , you are likely to be quite fond of the " ClickPad".

Signs of cost - costing are everywhere on the computer including:

-
Super - thin materials
soft screws on the hard drive
Thinner casing material overall
br />- Zero status lights ( no hard disk , battery
wireless lights ) ( Just a stupid illuminated dot in the " ThinkPad " logo on the back side of the laptop display ( thanks for
No latching mechanism for the display ( though I suppose this was something

may have broken for some on old models)
-

Flimsy CD tray < br />
Cost - cutting measures are probably inevitable in the ultra - competitive computer segment ,
just beware
the once rock - solid feel to ThinkPad models of old is simply not here .

This leaves me with the following overall summary of the T540p model:

Pros:
-
Excellent battery life < br />-

Keyboard button to lock operating system ( useful if you like to secure your computer before you walk away)

Cons:
-

easily damaged screws to hard drive access panel < br />- Poor speaker location ( they are simply downward facing slits in the front of the case)
-
Hardware specific functions shared with the function keys are now primary instead of secondary < br />-
No longer any dedicated hardware buttons for volume , speaker
wireless < br />- Fixed CD / DVD drive means no Ultrabay option .

A big negative if you liked the ability to add a second internal hard drive as well as being able to easily swap out said second drive.
- Terrible " ClickPad " touchpad design for TrackPoint users results in left - click mouse button being too far left for activation with right thumb if you work
Hardware specific functions shared with the function keys are now primary instead of secondary
means if you use F5 for Refresh
F3 for Next in Windows a lot you will either be annoyed to have to press the Fn key as well

remember to press the Fn+Esc key to lock the FnLk key on to make Functions active.
-
Windows 8.1 power management does not work well with some T540p models .
on my model you can not dim the display
power is not actually cut ( it glows dimly instead of actually being powered off ) .
The off - center keyboard is not an issue
use it from there you may find the offset annoying

less than natural feeling < br />
Overall , this is a very disappointing product
by far the worst ThinkPad laptop I have used in the last 10 years in terms of ergonomics
As a long time Thinkpad user I agree
take the time to adapt themselves to the changes are rewarded with the highest Thinkpad experience

I looked at a lot of gaming laptops trying to get  the best bang for my buck since I did not want to spend more than fifteen - hundred on one .

In the end the tipping point was the video card as the 870 m is the highest end mobile card unless you want to pay about five - hundred more for the current flagship the GTX 880 m.  Apparently the 870 is noticeably better performing than the 860 ( according to notebook check )
/>Unfortunatelyl the first one I got was faulty

Chromebooks can do almost anything a Windows computer can do .
if I switched to Mint.com then I could forget about Windows altogether .
The most common complaint I see from people
they fear living without Microsoft Office .
you can use Microsoft 's Office online for free .
You can use it either with the free MS Onedrive ( 15 GB storage in the cloud )
Of course , there is nothing wrong with Google Docs , Sheets ,
They work if you are connected to the internet
they just look like the older MS Office 2003 apps .

In my opinion they are better than the MS Office apps.

Major advantages of Chrome OS over Windows.

SCREEN
This display on this laptop is a gorgeous 3200x1800 screen ,
it looks awesome .

this is definitely incorrect - the one I got runs at 3200x1800 out of the box .

clear ,
everyting I have tried out has looked great on it .
I am not personally a big fan of touch screens on laptops ,
everything I messed around with worked well .

I have to admit
even after using the touchscreen for a while there is not really any noticible smudging at all .

flicking away a bit of dust on the screen ends up opening up menus

does not ( like thie & # 34;Alienware Product Registration&#34 ;

KEYBOARD
< br />The keyboard is surprisingly comfortable considering they had to cram it into a 13 inch laptop .
The keys feel nice to the touch ,
the space is used well .
I am especially happy to see
I am glad they are here .

comfortable.

it is not anywhere near as smooth as the one on my Macbook Pro .
this is a only 13&#34 ; laptop , the trackpad is a good size
fairly comfortable to use -
the texture of the pad is a little rougher than I would like
this leads to scrolling
is just not completely smooth - the cursor tends to jump
Right - clicking is also a little finicky , sometimes I end up left - clicking
I intend to right - click .
Gestures work fairly well with one major exception:
The gesture behavior was extremely buggy in Chrome .
Sometimes it would scroll correctly , sometimes it would snap the page to the top
bottom , it would often draw strange rectangles everywhere as I gestured .
I tried to resolve it through driver updates
did not have any luck .

have information on the topic:

is a definite bummer
the scrolling works very well ,

I am disappointed I can not use Chrome.

SPEAKERS <

tasks vary so wildly ,
I think for the correct customer it is an awesome product .
